job_title: Senior Data Scientist, Customer Engagement Analytics
job_Description: About the team  Zillow Group is currently seeking a Senior Data Scientist to join the Customer Engagement Analytics (CEA) team. On the CEA team, we’re passionate about understanding the customer journey on our platforms through deep analysis and measurement. We relentlessly advocate for a seamless and delightful home shopping experience from dream to reality! The team works closely with the product organization to discover strategic opportunities in areas spanning the search and discovery process, membership and re-engagement, evaluation and curation of potential homes, and personalization for both the Zillow and Trulia brands. Finally, we scale this work by partnering with engineering teams to build and maintain key analytics tools and infrastructure.       About the role     In this role, you will deliver deep insights about how each customer can optimize their unique journey on Zillow using your expertise in: customer and product analytics, propensity modeling, causal inference, and/or experimentation. You will provide thought leadership in how we drive customer success by partnering with product teams to convert our insights into actions. Through this role you will have frequent opportunities to share your analyses and recommendations with colleagues across the organization and see the results of your efforts affect millions of people daily. You will:         Collaborate with Product Managers to develop evidence based approaches to finding gaps in the customer experience, measuring efficacy of particular solutions, and incorporating findings into the next iteration.      Utilize advanced analytics including clustering, propensity modeling, and other explanatory and causal inference techniques to gain a clearer picture of customer behavior.      Create compelling data stories and visualizations to influence decision makers.      Serve as a mentor and resource to other data scientists on the team by hosting learning academies and authoring detailed documentation.        This role has been categorized as a Remote position. “Remote” employees do not have a permanent corporate office workplace and, instead, work from a physical location of their choice which must be identified to the Company. Employees may live in any of the 50 US States, with limited exceptions. In certain cases, an employee in a remote-designated job may need to live in a specific region or time zone to support customers or clients as part of their role.    In Colorado, the standard pay range for this role is $127,100.00 - $203,000.00 Annually. This range is specific to Colorado and may not be applicable to other locations.       Who you are     You are ready to bring your data and analytics expertise to transform what it means to dream, search, and find a home. You seek to understand the many needs of our customers and advocate for them at every turn. You have an appreciation of the unique challenges posed by a multi-platform and multi-brand experience. Additionally, we expect you to have:         An undergraduate or Master’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g. mathematics, engineering, statistics, finance, or similar)      4+ years of work experience involving quantitative data analysis and complex problem solving. Experience working with product teams strongly preferred      A strong understanding of statistical concepts, measurement issues, and inference techniques.      Mastery of SQL, Excel, and either Python or R, along with some experience with Tableau, Mode, or other visualization software.      Extensive experience querying multi-terabyte-sized noisy data sets such as clickstream data.      Experience with ETL pipelines, scheduling and productionalizing a plus.      Ability to work cross-functionally and push partners to connect customer problems to business strategy.      Strong written, verbal, and visual communication skills. As the most-visited real estate website in the United States, Zillow® and its affiliates offer customers an on-demand real experience. job_Description: Overview:        Do you want to create a legacy of meaningful research for the greater good? Do you want to lead and contribute to work in support of an organization that addresses some of today’s most challenging problems that face our Nation? Do you want to work with engaging and collaborative teams? Then join us in the Data Sciences and Analytics Group at the Pacific Northwest National Laboratory (PNNL)!              For more than 50 years, PNNL has advanced the frontiers of science and engineering in the service of our nation and the world in the areas of energy, the environment and national security. Help us advance this frontier and protect our nation!
